author: vors
body:
Looks like the version that we use is already outdated

```
> ./install.ps1 -version 1.0.0.001718 -channel beta
dotnet_install: Preparing to install .NET Tools to C:\Users\sevoroby\AppData\Local\Microsoft\dotnet
dotnet_install: Downloading dotnet-dev-win-x64.1.0.0.001718.zip from https://dotnetcli.blob.core.windows.net/dotnet/beta/Binaries/1.0.0.0
01718
Invoke-WebRequest : BlobNotFoundThe specified blob does not exist.
RequestId:f48dff31-0001-00b7-60a8-836980000000
Time:2016-03-21T19:34:27.4427745Z
At D:\dev\PowerShell\install.ps1:82 char:9
+ $resp = Invoke-WebRequest -UseBasicParsing "$DotNetUrl/$DotNetFileNam ...
+         ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
    + CategoryInfo          : InvalidOperation: (System.Net.HttpWebRequest:HttpWebRequest) [Invoke-WebRequest], WebException
    + FullyQualifiedErrorId : WebCmdletWebResponseException,Microsoft.PowerShell.Commands.InvokeWebRequestCommand
```

We need a good reliable way to install `dotnet`

comments.author: andschwa
comments.body: This is supposed to be it, recommended by the CLI team. Grr.

comments.author: andschwa
comments.body: We can try just the latest, but that caused some developers problems last time, as sometimes CLI would break on CI.

title: Dotnet install script is out of date
